results.title: Head start: meeting the computer challenge
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Intended for women in the paid work force and young girls about to choose a career, this half-hour film, part drama, part documentary, urges viewers to acquire the skills for careers involving new technologies. In the documentary segments, women who hold senior positions in the field of microtechnology describe changing occupational patterns, and stress the need for training and job-mobility programs. In the dramatic portions, an office worker and her teenaged daughter discover how the technological revolution will affect their careers and decide how to attain their goal of financial independence.

results.title: Hayley's home movie
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer, John Spotton, Michael Scott and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of the Finding Our Way series, which deals with contemporary family-life issues, this is the story of twelve-year-old Hayley, who must acknowledge the finality of parental separation when her father’s new girlfriend abruptly enters her life. All the issues surrounding separation are realistically evoked. Hayley’s anger, and her fantasy about her parents reuniting, are the central focus. But Hayley’s personality is irrepressible; she finds strength in her own imagination and creativity, thus effecting the beginnings of a resolution.

results.title: Hawks & doves
results.creator_credit: Brian Rapsey and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: A sailor abandons his military duties and tries to hide himself from the national coverage of his desertion, and the war escalating in the Gulf. He finds comfort with his Uncle who served in Vietnam, but clashes with his father who did not go to war. Cast includes Andrew Mayne, Dorothy Blayney and Phillip Motherwell.

results.title: Hawaiian hospitality
results.creator_credit: Matson Hotels and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Describes the facilities provided by the Matson hotels in Hawaii for the comfort and pleasure of holiday makers. All the thrills of surf-riding and surf skiing are portrayed. Glimpses of the informal buffet dinners provided by the Royal Hawaiian Hotel; islanders performing native dances before the guests and a mannequin parade on the terrace. Follows the tourists as they visit neighbouring islands.

results.title: Haven of peace
results.creator_credit: African Film Productions and Department of Social Development (Dar-es-Salaam)
results.brief_description: Considers the place of Dar-es-Salam in the development of a large multi-racial community. The port is represented as a colorful mixture of the old and the new, its traditional life and culture existing side by side with modern health, education and social services, housing schemes, and improvements in trade and communications.

results.title: Have I ever lied to you before?
results.creator_credit: John Spotton, Colin Low and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Advertising and Jerry Goodis are an inseparable combination. This fascinating documentary takes a behind-the-scenes looks at the power plays in the advertising business in Canada. It explores the conflict and the difficulties faced on the production of one particular commercial which Goodis does not like, yet has to sell. Includes a ‘Hush Puppies’ commercial showing people talking to their feet. Photographed by Douglas Kiefer.

results.title: Have a healthy baby: pregnancy. - Rev. ed. (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jane Treiman, Spencer Peel and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Follows the process of pregnancy, explaining how a baby develops, what a mother experiences, and what prenatal care is necessary to ensure a healthy baby. Animation details the important stages of growth of the human embryo from conception through pregnancy. Stresses the complexity of the process and the role nutrition, exercise and good health habits play.

results.title: Haunting of Barney Palmer (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Barney Palmer was eight years old when his haunting began. Whispers in the waves, images in the mirror, voices in his dreams. Is it the ghost of his great Uncle Barnaby or is it the ghost of somebody not yet dead? Someone, somewhere in this world or in the next has promised to carry him away. For Barney, the answer lies close within the strength of his home.

results.title: Hatred
results.creator_credit: Mitzi Goldman, Rosemary Blight, Australian Film Commission and R B Films
results.brief_description: ‘Hatred’ documents various type of hatred and their consequences, beginning with the hatred that led to the filmmaker’s father fleeing the Holocaust. This in turn leads to an exploration of hatred in the lives of the poor and the coloured in New York, and then to the complex clash of identity, religion, history and emotions between the Israelis and the Palestinians. This is a personal journey that asks bigger social questions about identity and prejudice in the modern world. It is a challenge for anyone willing to broach the issue of the origins of hatred in contemporary society. Director Mitzi Goldman presents herself with this very challenge by confronting hatred head on in an attempt to reach enlightenment. A study guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Hated: G.G. Allin & the murder junkies (D)
results.creator_credit: Todd Phillips and A Skinny nervous guy production
results.brief_description: Todd Phillips uncompromising documentary chronicles the extreme life, music and tragic death of cult hardcore rocker G.G. Allin. Along with his back up band the Murder junkies, Allin wrote and performed nihilistic anthems such as “Bite it you scum”, “I wanna kill you” and “Fuck authority”. Filmed during one of the bands notorious tours, Phillips unflinchingly captures Allin’s violent, self destructive stage performances which involve among other things, self mutilation, public masturbation and defecation on stage. Featured also are Allin’s die hard fans who at times go to disturbing lengths to please their number one rock hero, all the while egging Allin on to fulfil his death wish of suiciding on stage. Allin’s anti-social behavior aside, “Hated” ultimately offers a radically alternative version of the sanitized fantasy of the rock n roll rebel, instead presenting a tragic loner on the outer margins of popular culture.
